thread.title: N.J. high school wrestler revived on mat with defibrillator
thread.title_full: N.J. high school wrestler revived on mat with defibrillator

author: Mari A. Schaefer
title: N.J. high school wrestler revived on mat with defibrillator
text:
N.J. high school wrestler revived on mat with defibrillator Updated: January 5, 2017 — 12:14 PM EST 308 Share 
Mari A. Schaefer works for the Inquirer. More by Mari A. Schaefer Arrow icon 
A New Jersey high school wrestler is alive after his heart stopped during a match and he was revived with a defibrillator. 
Brandon Gonzalez, a 220-pound wrestler and junior from Donovan Catholic in Toms River, was participating in a tri-match Wednesday night with Toms River North and Lakewood when he fainted and his heart stopped during a pin, NJ.com reports. 
The team's head coach Steven Glawson, who is an oral and maxillofacial surgeon, jumped into action along with the Lakewood trainer, assistant coaches, two off-duty EMTs, and another physician who was in the bleachers. They performed CPR and used an a utomated external defibrillator, or AED, to revive Gonzales. 
Quick-acting pros shock, revive wrestler on mat; otherwise 'he'd be dead' https://t.co/6c90546xjH 
— Matt Trapani (@Trapper908) January 5, 2017 
"There was a group of five or six people working on him and another three ready to jump in if necessary," Glawson, who performed chest compressions, told NJ.com. "From start to finish lasted about 20 minutes, but from the time he was hooked up to the AED was probably about two minutes." 
Gonzalez, who regained consciousness and asked about rejoining his teammates, was taken by ambulance to Jersey Shore University Medical Center in Neptune, N.J., where he was scheduled to undergo tests. 
The remainder of the match was canceled, Shore News Network reported. 
"He called me [from the hospital] and wanted to know if we won the match and where his warm-ups were," Glawson told NJ.com. 
Lifesaving CPR given by @CoachJHuber at 2night's @TrnWrestling/DC match. PROUD OF YOU!! @TomsRiverPatch @Bob_Badders @smfalk @Josephzedalis
